reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was the 4th time we have stayed at the Glen Rothay - the first time being on our honeymoon 22 years ago (we got married on the day Chernobyl blew up!). We have experienced several managements of the hotel, and this was by far the best!
reviews.title: 4th Time Here - And It Was The Best Yet!

likes.liked: — The service and overall ambience of the hotel
likes.disliked: — The proximity to the main Ambleside to Grasmere road made it a bit noisy!

reviews.text: Everything about our stay was excellent - the food, the room (we stayed in the Rydal Suite), the real ale and the badgers (we saw SEVEN on Saturday night).
reviews.title: Friendly, quirky and great location

reviews.text: The manager, Mal, worked like a Trojan while we were there, but was unfailingly courteous and helpful (not just to us) - he even maintained his good humour when a group of 13 or so people arrived, unannounced, to eat on Saturday evening!
reviews.title: ok

reviews.text: We did not experience any problems with the hot water (as described elsewhere) although showering while holding the shower head in your hand is definitely an acquired skill.
reviews.title: What Fun

reviews.text: This is a proper down to earth country hotel, no airs and graces, just good old fashioned service and ambience.
reviews.title: Great Area, Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Best place we've stayed in the Lake District so far, excellent room and hotel, good food, great staff, dog friendly and the badgers were worth going for on their own!! Couldn't fault it, highly recommended, can't wait to go back
reviews.title: 10 year anniversary

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Loved everything about this charming place! Friendly, genuine staff. Relaxed, cosy bar serving good wholesome grub and interesting ales. Stayed in Grasmere, one of the smaller rooms. A few quirks but added to the character of the place! Can't find the words to describe the badger experience. Will definitely return.
reviews.title: Enchanting

reviews.text: Having stayed at this hotel twice before . we were looking forward to a pleasant break. We were put a large room with a 4 poster bed . The bed was a disaster, very hard any movement provoking a loud twang from the springs. we complained and were moved the next day to another room with 2 single beds. Slightly better but the floor sloped so the beds were still uncomfortable. The food was expensive for what it was . The staff didn't seem at all interested . The hotel had gone downhill considerably from our stay the previous year. Very disappointing , we will not be going back
reviews.title: Nice location , Shame about the hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having read some of the reviews here AFTER booking I was a little concerned about how this place would turn out to be...So, generally not too bad ,just in need of a little TLC . Our room the Rydal suite was very spacious with a four poster bed and enormous bathrom .Generally a charming characterful room that just needs a bit of smartening up,chipped paintwotk etc. No little extras such as robes, toiletries,just pump dispenser of soap .Reasonably adequate Tea tray. Quite noisy due to being beside a busy road and also noise from adjacent room's TV very annoying at 1am ! Very basic breakfast. Packet cereals, ,juice, plus usual cooked breakfast,which my husband informed me was very good ! I would not return simply because you can do much better for the price( per room £130 b&b) in this area.
reviews.title: great potential !

reviews.text: I use tripadvisor before booking holidays, hotels and sometimes even restaurants and appreciate different people have different view on places. I honestly cannot understand though how this hotel could possibly receive so many (or in fact any) 5 star reviews.
reviews.title: Why tripadvisor reports should be treated with care...
Terrible Food
reviews.text: It is in a good location (if you have a car), serves a decent english breakfast and a couple of good local ales, is clean and the staff are polite and helpful but my enthusiasm ends there. The entrance to the hotel and the bar is very very scruffy and urgently in need of a refurb. The 'restaurant' is also very dated and soulless, There is another bar which is slightly more inviting but it was not open when we visited. We were not tempted to have dinner in the hotal.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a standard twin room which was quite small with two uncomfortable beds and a selection of mismatched and old furniture. The rooms general decor was very dated and quite dismal. I did see into a superior room and that did look a little smarter but I cannot see that a price of £130 a night was justifed. Our room had a reasonable sized bathroom with a bath but only a handshower and no curtain. The bath took ages to fill - water is supplied locally and I guess the pressure is low.
reviews.title: Great welcome and great food

reviews.text: Its not the worst place I have stayed in but there are many better hotels or B&Bs in the area for around the same price. We were not surprised to find out that we were the only guests on the first night of our stay when the rest of the hotels in the Ambleside/Keswick area were almost full.
reviews.title: never again

reviews.text: I arranged to spend 3 nights and came to The Lakes for a wedding.
reviews.title: I enjoyed my stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I arrived late and was please with the welcome from staff. Breakfast was a treat, it was very filling and well prepared.The evening meal was fresh and enjoyable in the bar. The only aspect of the restaurant come pub that I did not like were the dogs who naturally shock themselves and some dogs their fur floated over my meal.
reviews.title: The wonderful charm of the Glen Rothay must be experienced.

reviews.text: I loved the bed room, it was warm, clean and very big. The bathroom was large and clean. The locally made shower gel in the bathroom was beautifully smelling on the skin.
reviews.title: Don't eat here!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff were genuinely helpful, curteous and friendly. Love every minute and hope to return.
reviews.title: DISGUSTING

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our 5th stay at the Glen Rothay / Badger Bar in 18 months and the reason we keep coming back for more is simple: its a beautiful and enchanting hotel that is as quirky and charming as you can possibly wish for!
reviews.title: loved every minute
